meanings.definition: A new or different description of something.
meanings.sent1: She wrote several redescriptions of the painting to capture its beauty.
meanings.sent2: The artist's redescriptions of nature were always unique and captivating.
meanings.sent3: The redescriptions of the mysterious treasure map made it seem even more intriguing.
meanings.sent4: His poetic redescriptions of the city turned the streets into a vivid tapestry of words.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's redescriptions of historical events made them come alive in the students' minds.

meanings.definition: The act of describing something again in a different way.
meanings.sent1: After reading the book, she provided redescriptions of the characters to her friends.
meanings.sent2: His constant redescriptions of the crime scene confused the investigators.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's redescriptions of everyday situations always brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The scientist's redescriptions of complex theories simplified them for the students to understand.
meanings.sent5: The journalist's redescriptions of the event added a fresh perspective to the news article.
